greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of Dyck paths of semilength n, having no ascents and no descents of length 1, and having k UUDD's starting at level 0.
comment: Sum of entries in row n is the secondary structure number A004148(n-1) (n>=2).
Number of entries in row n is 1 + floor(n/2).
formula: G.f.=G(t,z)=1/(1 + z - zg - tz^2), where g=g(z) satisfies g=1 + zg(g - 1 + z).
G.f. of column k is z^{2k}/(1 + z - zg)^{k+1} (k>=0).
example: T(7,2)=3 because we have (UUDD)(UUDD)UUUDDD, (UUDD)UUUDDD(UUDD), and UUUDDD(UUDD)(UUDD) (the UUDD's starting at level 0 are shown between parentheses).
maple: G := 2/(1+z+z^2+sqrt((1+z+z^2)*(1-3*z+z^2))-2*t*z^2): Gser := simplify(series(G, z = 0, 18)): for n from 0 to 16 do P[n] := sort(coeff(Gser, z, n)) end do: for n from 0 to 16 do seq(coeff(P[n], t, k), k = 0 .. floor((1/2)*n)) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 07 2009
